title: 114_s2125
content: The Act titled "Small Business Lending and Economic Inequality Reduction Act of 2015" includes a section on the Community Advantage Program. The Small Business Act is amended to include a new Community Advantage Program for eligible development companies. The Small Business Act is amended to include a new Community Advantage Program for eligible development companies, including nonprofit intermediaries and certified community development financial institutions. The Small Business Act is amended to include the Community Advantage Program for eligible development companies, including nonprofit organizations approved by the Small Business Administration. The Small Business Act is amended to include the Community Advantage Program for eligible development companies, including nonprofit organizations approved by the Small Business Administration. The program defines terms such as 'Reservist' as a member of a reserve component of the Armed Forces and 'service-connected' as per section 101(16) of title 38, United States Code. The term 'small business concern in an underserved market' refers to a small business located in a low- or moderate-income community, a HUBZone, or a designated community. A small business concern in an underserved market includes a community designated as an empowerment zone or enterprise community with over 50% of employees residing in a low- or moderate-income area and in existence for up to 2 years. Small business concerns eligible for the Community Advantage Program must be owned and controlled by veterans or service-disabled veterans, or have at least 51 percent ownership by veterans. Small business concerns eligible for the Community Advantage Program must be owned and controlled by veterans, service-disabled veterans, or individuals with at least 51 percent ownership by military personnel or their spouses. The Community Advantage Program guarantees loans for small business concerns owned by veterans, service-disabled veterans, military personnel, or their spouses. The Community Advantage Program guarantees loans for small business concerns in underserved markets, with a maximum loan amount of $350,000. The maximum loan amount under the program is $350,000, and the Administrator will promulgate regulations within 1 year to carry out the program, similar to the Community Advantage Pilot Program. The Administration's Advantage Pilot Program, in effect before this paragraph's enactment, will be replaced by new regulations. Section 3(r) of the Small Business Act is amended accordingly. The Small Business Act is amended to exclude covered institutions from the definition of a business concern. Subparagraphs are also restructured for clarity. The Small Business Act is amended to exclude covered institutions from the definition of a business concern. Subparagraphs are restructured for clarity by redesignating and adjusting margins. SEC. 3. Expanding the purposes of advances and collateral available to community development financial institutions. Section 10(a) of the Federal Home Loan Bank Act is amended to include community development financial institutions as defined in the Riegle Community Development and Regulatory Improvement Act of 1994.
